articles.author: Deidre McPhillips and Christina Maxouris, CNN
articles.title: Less than 0.001% of fully vaccinated Americans died after a Covid-19 breakthrough case, CDC data shows - CNN
articles.description: Less than 0.004% of people fully vaccinated against Covid-19 experienced a breakthrough case resulting in hospitalization and less than 0.001% died from the disease, according to the latest data from the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

articles.author: Rodney E Rohde
articles.title: Commentary: What happens if people stay unvaccinated? The US shows the answer - CNA
articles.description: The US has split into “two Americas,” one of the unvaccinated and one of the vaccinated. The differences in deaths and hospitalisations between the two populations are striking, say two researchers.
articles.content:
SAN MARCOS, Texas: In recent weeks, one piece of data has gotten a lot of attention: That 99.5 per cent of all the people dying from COVID-19 in the US are unvaccinated.
Since the start of the pande… [+6015 chars]

articles.title: Millions of Americans at risk of eviction as Covid-19 cases spike - Hindustan Times
articles.description: With the clock ticking down to Sunday, the US was braced for a heartbreaking spectacle -- families with their belongings at the curbside wondering where to go. | World News
articles.content:
Millions of Americans face could find themselves homeless starting Sunday as a nationwide ban on evictions expires, against a backdrop of surging coronavirus cases and political fingerpointing.

articles.title: Millions of Americans at risk of losing homes amid surge in Covid-19 cases - News24
articles.description: Millions of Americans could find themselves homeless starting on Sunday when a nationwide ban on evictions expires, even as billions in government funds meant to help them go untapped.
articles.content:
• A nationwide ban on residential evictions in the United States will expire on Sunday amid a surge in coronavirus cases due to the Delta variant.
